items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Higher than normal tides over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from today, Wednesday 22 October, and for the next three days. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides and surge from a low pressure system. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides and forecast weather conditions throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 00:15 to 02:15 on Thursday 23 October. 
Tide levels will be high around the boat yard in Felixstowe Ferry hamlet at the end of Ferry Road, and along riverside areas in Woodbridge and Waldringfield, as well as in surrounding marshland. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Harwich of 2.63 mAODN at 1:15am, tomorrow Thursday 23 October, which is 0.63m above tide tables, Wind Force 6, Easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing locks and flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Suffolk and Essex coast from Felixstowe to Clacton including Orwell and Stour estuaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: North Sea, River Orwell, River Deben

items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible Flooding is possible from 00:15am to 02:15am on Thursday 23 October. 
The flood gates at Felixstowe seafront will be closed. The waterfront at Pin Mill, and The Strand at Wherstead under the Orwell Bridge may be flooded.  Water may be on the quay at Mistley. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at Harwich of 2.63mAODN at 1:15am, tomorrow Thursday 23 October, which is 0.63m above tide tables, Wind Force 6, Easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing locks and flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message:
Forecast high river levels tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 from the early hours and into Thursday morning. 
Heavy rain is forecast overnight and into Thursday morning. Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to rivers from around 3am on Thursday. We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Thursday though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message:
Forecast high river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 . 
Heavy rain is expected from Wednesday evening into Thursday morning. Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers from around 2am on Thursday. The main areas of concern are Newton Abbot, Kingsteignton, Teignmouth, Shaldon, Bovey Tracey, Kingskerswell, Dawlish and Dawlish Warren.

We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Thursday though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:30AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The north Norfolk coast from Old Hunstanton, to and including Cley
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 0700 to 0900 on Thursday 23 October. 
We expect to see water on roads and paths to beaches and on the quays in Brancaster, Burnham Overy, Holkham, Wells and Blakeney. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at Wells of 3.52mAODN at 8:00am tomorrow, Thursday 23 October, which is 0.68m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, Easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing locks and flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 0030 to 0230 on Thursday 23 October. 
Clacton Promenade, Lee-over-Sands and Brightlingsea sea front may see some wave overtopping and spray. The Strood at Mersea Island, Coast Road and car parks on the front at West Mersea, and the Hythe and Promenade at Maldon may be flooded. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Clacton of 2.86mAODN at 1:30am, tomorrow Thursday 23 October, which is 0.44m above tide tables, Wind Force 7, South-easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing locks and flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from Heacham to north of King's Lynn in Norfolk
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:15am to 10:15am on 23.10.2025 
Areas most at risk are Heacham, Snettisham, Ingoldisthorpe, Dersingham and Wolferton. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 4.51mAODN at 8:15am on Thursday 23, which is 0.91m above tide tables, wind Force 8, Northerly. The high tide tomorrow afternoon is expected to be as high. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:15am to 10:15am on 23.10.2025 
Areas most at risk are around Hunstanton seafront.  Flood gates in the area will be closed by the Local Authority which will make access difficult. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 4.51mAODN at 8:15am on Thursday 23, which is 0.91m above tide tables, wind Force 8, Northerly. The high tide tomorrow afternoon is expected to be as high. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast at Coalhouse Fort
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 01:00 to 03:00 on Thursday 23 October. 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths. 
We are closing locks and flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.
